is in town and last night on the way back from margaritas, plantains, and some ricockulously awesome cuban desserts, we stumbled upon approximately 200 billion flood lights and miles of electronic cords wrappings around the block i live on. plus, trucks with the Paramount logo. it was pretty clear some big production was taking place; i had seen the cords around my building for 2 days but had no idea what for...well guys, it was for the BEOUF (can i call him 'the beouf' please and thank you). and no i didn't see his smarmy young ass nor did i care too, but i did get to catch a glimpse of my back alleyway being morphed into "France." there was smoke (or dry ice? unsure) emanating in large quantities from behind fake dumpsters with french grafitti on them. my fave had a little grafitti robot and said "LES THUGS." tessa took pics with her crazy awesome camera that even makes a half-eaten piece of toast look like it's in a shot for Gourmet. we made "pals" with some old dude that worked on set and he let us past the barricades to glimpse the end of the shooting. there were at least 6 major cameras on wheels doing their thing. apparently a giant transformer was somewhere in the alley, but i couldn't see with all the floodlights what was happening. all i saw was that my building had a sign saying "Ecole Militaire" (military school) and even the bridal shop at the corner had a fake awning to make it French. i didn't see Transformers I, nor do i care to, but now i want to see Part Deux just to see my building and you know, les thugs. ok fine, i'll probably just rent the dvd 3 years from now if i can remember to care at all. very unexpected and strange ending to the night! GO BEOUF GO.

*Not what I saw at all.

how come nobody told me about POLYVORE???? because i'm not 12?! i'm telling you, this is addictive and amazing for curing boredom (if you're say, staying in this weekend due to empty walletness, like myself). it allows you to choose from thousands of fashion/beauty items andmake your own "magazine" layouts as though you're some cyber-loon wannabe anna wintour. granted, i'm sure most people on this site are 15 year-olds with bad photoshop skillz but hell if i care. love love love!!!
CLICK IT!
is it just me, or does Lindsay's little sister look like a mean pterodactyl of sorts??? and she's like what, 14?!

HELP. does anyone know how to block a whole website from popping up (not just a little ad). i'm using safari and out of nowhere, this annoying and creepy site keeps popping up (http://ip24.swamipredicts.com/20628?C=5840). i'm starting to think i should freaking SEE WHAT THE DANG SWAMI TELLS ME at this point. but i am not going to, just on principle. i thought it was popping up through myspace but i know i'm not running my cursor on anything; i've restarted safari 3 times and i'm not even on myspace anymore. any thoughts (yes i have 'block popups' checked under preferences)? SO. FREAKING. ANNOYING.

i'm really effin annoyed. when you have an issue with a friend, or you're mad at them, the most proactive thing to do is to talk about it. at least if you give two shits about them. and i would assume you give at least one shit if you've hung out with them on a bi- to tri-weekly basis for about 3 months and told them all your innermost, girly secrets. but maybe that's just me. maybe other people out there can share their time and their feelings and their secrets at the drop of a hat with just about....anybody? when you're 12, confronting a friend with an issue may not seem like a reasonable thing to do. hell, what 12 year old is looking for reason? you just want to ride your 10-speed and crush on the spiked-hair douchebag behind you in math class. you don't need any drama beyond who-kissed-who at samantha rosenberg's bat mitzvah. but i would think, after oh i don't know, 21, 25 years of age...that if you invest time with someone then you can at least have the balls to tell them if/why you're mad at them. even if you don't want to be their friend anymore you can say "hey, you did this, and i'm not cool with it....later." as opposed to pretending they don't exist. especially if they are trying to extend a fucking olive branch. so yea, what the hell am i talking about. i'm talking about my so-called first "best friend" in Philly. who i've spend countless hours with and bought food and beer for just because i considered her a worthy person. and now i'm being ignored and i'm not sure why. because i didn't want to walk around nyc for hours this past weekend when i could barely walk to the bathroom due to a back injury? shit. i don't know. i'm constantly amazed at the immaturity and lack of compassion of the seemingly intelligent adults i know. boys issues are hard enough. i don't need shit from people who i consider my friends.

well the past few days have sucked (minus cut copy on friday, the news that is visiting still, and 's amazing health guidance). i got a letter dated may 12 telling me that i would get my economic stimulus payment around the 16th. i was wary because my entire tax return went to my student loans debts...but well then, the letter came. plus it made sense to me that i would get it if its goal was to you know, go back into the economy, as opposed to back to the government or to pay off loans. so i paid off all my bills ahead of time, bought people bday gifts and thank you gifts and did extra food shopping and apartment shopping and errand shopping, etc etc. all the while thinking, yay, my check is coming and i am finally getting some much-needed things paid for! WELL LO AND BEHOLD, today i get another letter saying that my $600 also went to my student loans, which by the way, i am paying off every month. more than 400 every month! what the hell do they want from me?! so thank you government. if you're going to screw me over, can you at least not trick me first? that's all i friggin ask. can you at least not do surprize buttsecks on me, government???? jeez. in other suckage news, the slipped disc in my back is worse than ever. i had to crawl to the bathroom on saturday because i couldn't walk. also, my first good gal pal here in philly has decided to ignore me because i didn't want to go to nyc with her on saturday.....which was also because of my back. granted, i was passed out and i think she had been waiting for my answer which was rude of me, but i'm pretty sure it's not too cool to ignore me in return, and then take me off her myspace tops bullshit. what is this, kindergarten? well i'll say this much. this week has got to get better. at least can come visit now that she got her 'stimulus' check. i'm going to go bury my head in a pillow and watch some dvds and turn on mah heating pad and hopefully pass out.

i want to get a slanket for my mom for Mother's Day (yes her gift is going to be late). i can't believe some jerkface patented this and is making money off of it. no fair. but perfect for my moms since she is perpetually freezing (in miami, inexplicably) and also perpetually wrapped in throw blankets. and perpetually in bed when not at work. ah america, making laziness more efficient one slanket at a time.

AM I CORRECT HERE? 5) WASN'T LOCKE SHOT AND LEFT FOR DEAD. NOW HE'S BACK AT HORACE'S DEAD BODY WHO IS APPARENTLY ALSO STUCK IN A TIME WARP CHOPPIN' DOWN A TREE OVER N OVER. IS LOCKE DEAD TOO? i have a new friend, she owns a really cute shop called OMOI(the blog seems more updated than the actual website) where i seem to keep finding things i need to buy. everything from harajuku-inspired tops to furry pencil pouches with googly eyes on them to inexpensive framed art. i recently purchased 2 framed paintings of little black cats screwin' with household items (such as a fishbowl). we went out to Olde City on friday, which is sorta douchey; like it used to be cool but then some of the yuppie new jersey peeps took over. it still has some interesting bars and nice restaurants though. we only went there because a friend of hers had to interview some band that was playing. it was fun; the band was sorta akron-family-ish but sans ukulele, it would've just been semi-bland pop. last night we went to a club called the Barbary that i've been meaning to go to. it was fun to dance again...it's been a while. it was the 10th anniversary of a party called Sorted that's mostly britpop and late 90s style....it was MEGA CROWDED. loads of cute hipster-y guys, ladies....i got asked out by a guy i had met on douchespace but he seemed pretty wasted; i highly doubt he'll even remember that we met! anyways, i'm really happy i'm meeting some people outside of work and i'm realizing there is quite a bit to do here. by the way, has anybody seen Baby Mama? i love tina fey but i haven't seemingly gone to the movies in forever. apparently it takes place in philly...

all i wants is a nice little nap around 3 pm in the afternoon in my own apartment, when a dj who is apparently right outside my window starts playing a series of gay anthems, including a medley of every song madonna has ever recorded, at an unspeakable volume. it's been about an hour and it's still going on. it's drowning out my tv. this is what i get for living in the "gayborhood" of philly. i'm considering putting on something with sequins and going down there waving a white flag....wait, make it a pink flag. i just said to my cat, "you can't eat your own hair!" i need a drink

today was one of those days that i was somehow just really excited to be new to philadelphia and even just to be alone. i dog-sat for a few hours at my friend's house on South St. while walking the dog, i found a cute vintage shop and passed by a few interesting restaurants. i need to start writing things down! on the way home i picked up some gourmet mac n cheese and framboise (stumbled upon this odd convenient store-cum-beer specialist). honestly, i'm more of a wino than a beer drinker but they had so many amazing types of beer i had never heard of before. chocolate beer, fruity beer, beer in opaque red bottles and with art deco labels. this is definitely a drinking town. it's weird to me though that you can purchase alcohol on sundays yet you cannot buy it in grocery stores?!

is it just me or does will smith play the same character over and over...blah blah here to save the world blah blah king of mankind provin myself blah blah. like seriously, where is dj jazzy jeff and stuff.

i can cook...a little.  ok, a very little.  i'm decent at following recipes and good with spices though!  i'm usually too tired when i get home to prepare anything....

but i'd like to learn how to make not-too-difficult (unless the extreme deliciousness makes it worthwhile!) vegetarian and vegan recipes.  i would probably be more willing to slave over preparation for baked items. oh also, i still eat fish occasionally.

my main question is: does anyone know of a good vegetarian cookbook for semi-starters?  to learn some good basics?  and also....what types of kitchen utensils are of the utmost necessity?  i have crappy old bowls and pots and pans for the most part.  i do not have a kitchen aid.  though i would like one.  just because, you know, it's effin cute as hell, in a 1950s-bakelite-but-i'm-not-barefoot-and-pregnant-and-i-have-a-career sort-of way.

follow me on twitter (i'm lemoncayke).  i'm trying to get into it.  because like, i obviously am not online enough.


also, i just had a vegan vanilla cupcake.  JEALOUS?!



also, i need to go to bed.  pronto.





<font size=1>oh and if anyone knows how to access twitter on the ol' crackberry, lemme know.  when i try it doesn't seem to work...

i went to a coworker's bday party tonight at a really interesting bar called National Mechanics....ionic columns and all outside (used to be a bank in the 1800s, among other things)....bizarre lighting art and sculptures inside (pics to follow soon). anyways, i have been pretty down lately following the quick demise of whatever semblance of a "dating" thing i had going with stressful "dude". not down per se in general, but just over guys. and romance. and dating. and well, i mean, FINE. i should be single and loving it anyhow. but tonight i met my coworker's boyfriend's friend. and he was charming and nice and has the same taste in music, more or less. and we talked for like 2 hours. i gave him my number because he asked. i would hang out with him. but you know what. i just was NOT attracted to him. he wasn't bad looking, at all. but i'm picky and have weird, temperamental chemistry with people. there are guys that suck and that aren't even that attractive that i somehow "click" with on a base, sexual level. and model-types that i don't find remotely attractive. are my pheromones out of sync? should i go out with this guy if he calls me and give it a chance knowing he may like me and i feel.....nothing? urgh. also, i had chocolate cake. it was rich. it was delicious. it was like enough calories for the whole week.
Plus = the only things that are making my hair not fall out right now due to past over-processing! seriously. sephora. now. (and i've tried almost everything).

it's finally over. emotionally-unavailable dude took me to a nice restaurant and bought me expensive cocktails and continued to walk the line between "wow i like you" and "we shouldn't see eachother". WHAT. all the rum went straight to my head and i sorta suddenly freaked out.....it all clicked....and i was like "what the fuck am i even doing here?!" and i gave him 20 bucks and stomped out. it wasn't really a 'scene' ; i don't think anyone noticed. but it was sorta juvenile and i realize i tend to get myself into situations i can't control and i finally boil over and act like a retard. so yea. i don't think he really deserved it but i didn't deserve the confusion, either. so now i am slightly bummed but also relieved. i hate having bad blood with someone out there, already, in what is a new and exciting city for me. but i'm trying to focus on the new and exciting as opposed to the 'bad blood' aspect. also, regardless of this dude not being right for me, i do realize i have a lot of anger inside that i need to deal with.....anger that comes out when crappy dudes (or even friends) do or say something that rubs me the wrong way. i'd like to get a stupid self-help book and/or therapy...though i really don't have money or time for the latter....any thoughts? i feel like a loon. a relieved loon, but a loon nonetheless. on a positive note, one of my bffs, whom i haven't seen in a couple years, is coming into town tonight from nyc. she has an engagement brunch or something ghey tomorrow morning, but tonight we can hang out. i am waaaaay excited to see her. too bad i still haven't found my goddamn camera charger. oh, also, i finally met and hung out with last night. we went to a bar called Good Dog that has amazing food. i cannot stress how good the "bar" food is in philly. i had mac n cheese with crushed cornflakes on top and a blueberry muffin side.
before the grim reaper hospice cat made it into LOLs.

so i found this at the little asian market down the street (since i do not drive these days, it's the closest). and while it's not exactly asian (nor are most items there), it's seriously amazing. i mean, it satisfies my ice cream cravings that are often left crying in the corner of my brain when it comes to frozen yogurt. it's not the least caloric of frozen yogurts out there, but the mild honey taste and the granola bits make it well worth it for me.*
*not suitable for chocolate cravings.

well i know everyone's hangovers are different...but for the past few years, i tend to get nauseous really easily, with a wonderful headache to boot. usually the only thing that gets rid of my headaches is excedrin, but if i take that while feeling nauseated, i will throw up. so yesterday i forced down a granola bar, some vitamin water, and more regular water, all the while trying not to throw up. then i quickly took some emetrol to make sure i would keep this down. then the excedrin..... emetrol is awesome, it really does stop the nausea. there are definitely times when you need to throw up but it's good when you are just dry heaving and need to stop. within an hour, the emetrol allowed the excedrin to work and i felt brand-new again and was able to start really rehydrating myself. woo hooo. now if only i could keep myself to a 2-3 drink minimum so as to avoid creating hangovers in the first place!

watching X Files, major operations and/or discovery health shows with titles like "my life as a genetic anomaly" is probably not a good idea at 2 AM when you are tired and should be in bed. knowing this and still doing so, especially during a week of nightmares, is simply insane.

a guy that i met at the Addy awards, which my coworkers had invited me to.
he works at one of our many agency offices, so he's technically not a coworker.
he's already giving me mixed messages.  what is it with you guys anyways, tell
it like it is, jesus.

i was sick all weekend.  but i have many adventures lined up, mostly involving 
old pubs and museums.  possibly a little ben franklin and and maybe a veggie
cheesesteak.  oh yea, and shopping.  there is plentiful shopping in my 'hood.

oh and suzan is coming for a show next week, maybe i can go dance with her.

visit me....i need partners in crime!



pics soon...once i find my usb cord to upload.

you. yea you. i know you're reading this because i know how narcissistic you are. and even though i haven't posted in a while, i'm pretty sure you'll check to see if i have. just please know i am saying this more for my own mental cleansing than for your sick self-indulgence. first off, i may be many things. i may have many flaws. i can be cruel and rude and bitchy. i am easily angered. i cannot tolerate disloyalty among close friends. but i am not a liar. i will absolutely obligate myself to tell the truth. and if you ask me about it i will answer you plainly. everything i said to you was forthright. anything he relayed to you...well if it bothered you, you should have questioned me about it instead of simply believing him. hell i don't even know what i'm working with here. did i possibly say a few negative comments about you behind closed doors? why yes i did. i'm entitled to my own opinions. but i'm more than positive what i said has been grossly distorted by that putrid little jerk-off. and the fact that he would pass on such comments to you, ,when they were said in privacy and had no bearing on my liking or respect for you as a person just proves how lowdown and dirty he is willing to get to make a strike against ME.....at YOUR expense. he didn't care to spare your feelings to get his way. i'm not sure what you heard but i can only say that my statements were quite frankly, said en masse. i am one of like 8 billion people on the internet whom you continually bombard with your half-naked pictures and fake modeling "photography" gigs. i never disliked you, but it's still fucking annoying to chance upon your conceited posts. trust me, i'm not the only one who feels this way. in fact, the man with the small phallus had a few cruel comments of his own. i have done nothing or said anything to regret. to all others: i am back. i need to vent. i have had it up to HERE with Vegas. especially Las Vegans of the opposite sex. i have never met so many horrible attention-hungry vapid people in my life. los angeles hasn't proved to be much better, ahem. i am SO glad i have taken a new job and Philly and will be there soon. good bye to this hellhole of a city forever. i hope my few true friends that remain behind will find a way to a better city eventually as well. and taylor, if you're reading this....i doubt i can go to LA before i leave (the 15th) because next weekend will be my last here. you are more than welcome to come stay with me however. you have turned out to be a true friend and i am glad our former dramas are over. drama past 25 is just not....necessary!
STOP WRITING ABOUT YOURSELVES. NO ONE CARES THAT MUCH, WE'RE JUST BORED. JK LOLZ. (not for some ppl tho.)

no more "friends" in other cities.  not if you have a penis.  serious.  it's come to this.

what's new?  

i'm in trouble at work for being late.  they're watching me like hawks, ready to pounce if i make the wrong move.  right now i am feeling singled out and i'm really hating it.  i had to sign some kinda "warning" that had the most ridiculous verbiage i've ever encountered in a document. maybe i should hang the evil eye above my desk.

everything else is pretty boring here, not that it's unusual. 

i had dinner with my dad, but he still sucks.

i got a silver ipod nano and named it Lil' Woodrow.  now all i need is a new digicam and an overhyped iphone to fill up (a preferably new) purse.


one semi-awesome thing: i will be going to NYC for New Year's....haven't been in years.
i hope to fill up my "real city tolerance" tank for the new year.  who wants to hang?


ugh, too much peanut butter toast.

UPDATE: i need an MRI.  i may need surgery.  i am on steroids, a muscle relaxer called soma (awesome) and percocet (even more awesomer).  i can even kinda sorta stand straight now.  i am totally at work and totally not sober.

ok i don't have that. that's not even remotely funny but jill confuses it with scoliosis which i apparently APPEAR to have after my yearly back issue has resurfaced like an unwanted rejected superhero from the rubble of my body. i blame this all on either A) my dad, who had L5 vertebrae herniation and may have passed on to me and B) Candace FUCKING Goodwin...the girl who pummeled me to the concrete ground a few years back (the first signs of back pain started a week after). now the pain resurfaces every year....progressively worsening....maybe they are in cohorts to make me quadraplegic. anyways, i saw my first orthopedic surgeon today who gave me tons of drugs (hallelujah) and told me i need an MRI. so i guess i will have to go on from there. i am not allowed to exercise, which makes sense but sucks because i have been laying on my ass all weekend (save for one dinner and one bar-capade, where i also mostly sat on my ass). i feel like a lump of coal. i'm going to be left in naughty kids' stockings this xmas. oh the pain. i will gladly take an operation at this point. i hope i am still able to semi-function once these drugs set in, because Taylor's in town....i want to see her and go to the Jay Reatard/Tokyo Electron at the Double Down.

i'm SO over hearing/reading/seeing things about the Cobrasnake and/or Cory Kennedy. is anyone else fed up with these two? he's totes pseudo-famous for taking mediocre pics of half-naked drunk chicks at hipster hangouts. he's basically an institution now. people actually revere this talentless mofo. and while i'm on this rant, let me add that there are obviously plenty of other "party photographers" out there that i'd like to punch as well. i understand that it's fun to have your picture taken when you're drunk and wearing your urban outfitter/thrift store combo threads. hell, i'm guilty of hipster drunken picture-taking too. but i just can't believe that rags like NYLON are now buying into it (ok i can believe it but it's still worth poking fun at). i mean, these rags can afford really good photographers. today i clicked on urbn.com for their shoe sale and see that they've also paired up with the Cobrasnake.

Cory Kennedy with a nameless male trendster....btw, i think she's underrage and also....what is so great about her fashion sense? it's not anything new...am i mistaken?



Cory again, being um.....cute?



the guy who calls himself blah blah you know snakes n stuff.
i know i'm just adding fuel to the fire with this whole dumb Cobrasnake obsession. but it's sort-of meta, you know. i'm just fascinated with the fascination. it's like an anti-fascination. hahaha, Cory Kennedy and the Cobrasnake: The Interview You Haven't Been Remotely Waiting For.

my hair is darker than it's been in years.  it's a really dark blonde/light brown with some lighter highlights.  i also got a bunch chopped out of it and straight bangs.  i was trying to grow it, but with all the bleaching i had been doing....it was just falling apart.  i think i'm just a short hair girl, ya know.
update:  i am still at work.  it's sunday.  bring me pizza and a sleeping bag and i'll photoshop a gremlin for you.
